content.raw: It might not be related to this PR, but when I reset the world, the vehicle flies. Doing it with the world paused shows the sensor pose is not correct at the beginning.
content.html: It might not be related to this PR, but when I reset the world, the vehicle flies. Doing it with the world paused shows the sensor pose is not correct at the beginning.

content.raw:
ya looks like the nested model pose is not reset properly. Fixed in b81ff0b and added a test. 

Queued a jenkins [no gpu job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/45/)
content.html:
ya looks like the nested model pose is not reset properly. Fixed in b81ff0b and added a test.

looks ok

content.raw: Thanks, the model doesn't explode anymore. But now the plugin stops working after reset, the model keeps the same speed as before reset and doesn't follow things anymore. Is this a general problem with plugins and reset, or something which can be fixed in this PR?
content.html: Thanks, the model doesn't explode anymore. But now the plugin stops working after reset, the model keeps the same speed as before reset and doesn't follow things anymore. Is this a general problem with plugins and reset, or something which can be fixed in this PR?

content.raw: looks like the depth camera sensor doesn't get updated for a while after reset.. looking into it
content.html: looks like the depth camera sensor doesn't get updated for a while after reset.. looking into it

content.raw:
fixed problem with rendering sensor update times being overwritten due to race condition. fixed and added a test in df86019.

queued [nvidia jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/)
content.html:
fixed problem with rendering sensor update times being overwritten due to race condition. fixed and added a test in df86019.

queued nvidia jenkins build
jenkins build ok

code checker

Why is this change made?

content.raw: changed to fix problem with reseting nested model poses. Models can now have another model as it's parent so `SetWorldPose` wouldn't work.  Fix + test were added in b81ff0b
content.html: changed to fix problem with reseting nested model poses. Models can now have another model as it's parent so SetWorldPose wouldn't work. Fix + test were added in b81ff0b

content.raw: I've been seeing an `INTEGRATION_world_reset` test failure with dart since this was merged. I'll post more shortly
content.html: I've been seeing an INTEGRATION_world_reset test failure with dart since this was merged. I'll post more shortly

content.raw:
it actually appears to be a problem with nested models in dart; I'll post details in an issue

To reproduce, open the `nested_model.world` in the `worlds` folder. You can open it paused, but once you unpause it will crash.

~~~
gazebo --verbose -u -e dart worlds/nested_model.world
~~~
content.html:
it actually appears to be a problem with nested models in dart; I'll post details in an issue

To reproduce, open the nested_model.world in the worlds folder. You can open it paused, but once you unpause it will crash.

gazebo --verbose -u -e dart worlds/nested_model.world

content.raw: ok I see, I haven't really tested nested models much with physics engines other than ode and bullet. We should just disable loading nested models in simbody and dart?
content.html: ok I see, I haven't really tested nested models much with physics engines other than ode and bullet. We should just disable loading nested models in simbody and dart?

content.raw:
issue #1833

disabling sounds like a good idea for now. the test is already disabled for simbody; we should do it for dart too. currently gazebo crashes with those physics engines when loading a nested model.
content.html:
issue #1833

disabling sounds like a good idea for now. the test is already disabled for simbody; we should do it for dart too. currently gazebo crashes with those physics engines when loading a nested model.
